text: personality development skills
brought to you by let's talk Institute a
premier Academy for language and
finishing skills this is a demonstration
video on personality development for
complete program visit us at let's talk
company dot in personality development
skills episode nine communication skills
all human exchange personal or
professional is based on communication
it is our responsibility to make others
understand it is vital to be able to
communicate and interact effectively
with others using both verbal and
nonverbal communication communication is
an ongoing process derived from Latin
word communis which means to share the
word communication means sharing ideas
messages and words expressed through a
language communication is a two-way
process it requires understanding and
proper feedback hence for any
interaction to turn into communication
we need a communicator and a receiver
verbal communication verbal
communication is one of the most
important forms of communication it is
how we get our ideas thoughts and
feelings across to people in various
situations structure of verbal
communication verbal communication
consists of four crucial elements
content organization style and delivery
content
the purpose of communication should be
clearly stated the content should be
simple logical and relevant the
conclusion should be well supported and
accurate organization use a sequence to
organize the contents ensure that the
discussion flows from point to point
making it easier to comprehend style you
must be cautious of the choice of words
grammar and language usage use an
appropriate tone to address the audience
delivery in order to communicate the
message effectively maintain constant
eye contact with the listeners the
physical appearance also plays an
important role be well-groomed and
appropriately dressed you may also use
suitable visual or audio aids to support
your presentation use positive
statements rather than negative ones
an average person takes 48 percent
longer to understand a negative
statement to a positive affirmation some
tips for effective verbal communication
clarify your ideas before speaking
understand the purpose of your
communication understand the type of
audience you'll be presenting to pause
at key points to emphasize your body
language should support your words dress
appropriately listen actively nonverbal
communication
nonverbal communication refers to all
other modes of communication other than
the spoken or written form
it forms 55% of communication cycle
while verbal communication is 35% and
the content takes just 7% gestures are
an important indicator of communication
they tell us about the attitude of
people during conversation and
negotiations that is if they are open or
defensive self-controlled or bored there
are several ways in which you can learn
to read body language television is one
of the most effective one turn down the
volume and try to understand what is
being said by increasing the volume at
regular intervals of about three minutes
you will be able to check how accurate
your nonverbal readings are now take a
look at this video and try to understand
the communication happening you can make
your own statements from the expressions
and gestures in the video silent
[Music]
ideas come alive when you believe in
them because there's more to you class
meat for the big ideas in you written
communication skills as most business
communication is done through written
communication it is imperative to
understand and follow the rules of
writing use of inappropriate language
can disturb a communication cycle good
writing habits be active use active
voice instead of passive to write as the
later sounds impersonal and weak active
voice directly addresses the subject
enabling easier comprehension be brief
keep the communication brief but cogent
in order to make your communication
effective use simple words right to
express and not to impress be clear put
yourself in the red airs place and write
accordingly use fewer and relevant words
be positive use positive words and
expressions which communicate energy and
enthusiasm write with passion
business writing is persuasive writing
you have to try to convince someone to
take some action rules of good writing
right with the reader in mind decide on
the objective before you start writing
use KISS principle keep it short and
simple format to guide the reader use
words effectively use active and passive
voice appropriately avoid long
complicated and redundant sentences this
was a demonstration video on personality
development skills the complete program
visit us at let's talk company dot in or
you can subscribe to our channel on
YouTube by clicking the subscribe button
just above this video I hope you found
this video helpful kindly put your
comments on this video which would help
and motivate us making more videos thank
you for watching us
take care
